resources.string: The Taj Mahal is an invory-white marble mausoleum on the south bank of the Yamuna river in the Indian city of Agra,to house the tomb of his favorite wife,Mumtaz Mahal

India Gate is an iconic war memorial located in New Delhi, India. Designed by British architect Sir Edwin Lutyens and completed in 1931, it commemorates the 84,000 Indian soldiers who died during World War I

Qutub Minar is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of India\'s most iconic monuments, located in Mehrauli, Delhi. Built in the early 13th century by Qutb-ud-din Aibak, the founder of the Delhi Sultanate, this towering minaret stands 73 meters tall and is made of red sandstone and marble.

The Lotus Temple, located in New Delhi, India, is a stunning Bahá\'í House of Worship renowned for its unique lotus-inspired architecture. Designed by Iranian architect Fariborz Sahba and completed in 1986, the temple is constructed with 27 white marble petals arranged in clusters to form a lotus flower.
